intro: Racosperma blakelyi, commonly known as the Blakely's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and yellow flowers. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
